summary: 2D block-mining/crafting game concept. Initial MVP is a simple 2D world with only dirt (top) and stone (below) and click-to-mine mechanics; additional systems (crafting, shops, multiplayer, mobile controls) planned for later.
architectural_notes: Start with a minimal MVP (dirt+stone only); add crafting/shops/resources later in incremental updates.
Mining rule: a block is mineable only if at least one of its 4 sides (up/down/left/right) touches air; after mining, the new air cell reveals and enables mining of adjacent blocks.
Player is a simple movable marker for now (not a full stick-figure character).
Mobile/touch controls: show on-screen directional controls only on touch devices; Up input acts as Jump (not free upward flight).
Inventory MVP decision: no separate inventory screen; mined blocks/items are automatically added directly into a simple visible hotbar.
known_issues: Bug: player can currently "fly" (move upward freely); upward movement should be restricted to a jump action only.

existing_features.title: Implement a minimal 2D tile world with exactly two block types: a top dirt layer and a lower stone layer, with no additional layers or resources in this MVP.

Add click-to-mine interaction for blocks, where blocks require a configurable number of clicks to break; stone must require more clicks than dirt to demonstrate 'more clicks for more valuable/harder resources'.
Add a simple player-facing HUD/instructions in English that explains how to mine (click blocks) and that some blocks take more clicks to break.
Create and apply a coherent visual theme for the MVP UI (colors, typography, and tile styling) that fits a 2D mining game and is used consistently across the main screen and HUD.

Restrict mining so a block can only be mined when it is touching air on at least one of its four cardinal sides (up, down, left, right). Treat out-of-bounds space outside the world grid as air, so edge blocks are considered air-adjacent.

Implement fog-of-war rendering so that only tiles that are air, or non-air tiles that are air-adjacent in the 4-neighborhood, are visually revealed. All other non-air tiles must render as fully hidden (black) and must not be clickable/minable while hidden.
Add a movable player marker to the world grid and basic movement controls so the player “actually moves around.” The player must not be able to move into solid (non-air) tiles.
Update user-facing HUD text (English) to explain the new mining rule: blocks can only be mined if they are adjacent to air (up/down/left/right), and mining reveals adjacent blocks.
Add on-screen movement controls that appear only on touch devices and allow the player to move left, right, and down, plus a dedicated Jump control (using the up input as jump).

Implement jump + gravity movement rules so the player cannot "fly": the Up input (keyboard ArrowUp/W and touch Up) must perform a jump, and the player must fall when not supported by a solid tile beneath.
Update keyboard movement handling to align with the new controls: left/right/down remain directional movement, while up triggers jump (not vertical step movement).
Update the HUD user-facing movement instructions in English to describe: keyboard movement, touch-only on-screen controls, and that Up is Jump (no flying).
Add a visible hotbar UI to the main game screen that displays the player’s collected mined blocks, and treat the hotbar as the only inventory for this MVP.
When a tile is fully mined (i.e., it transitions from a solid block to air), automatically add exactly 1 of that block type to the hotbar inventory immediately (no intermediate pickup step).
Update the in-game HUD text (English) to mention that mined blocks automatically go straight into the hotbar.

new_feature_requests.summary: MVP: 2D world with two layers only (dirt on top, stone below)
Click-to-mine blocks; some blocks require more clicks based on value/hardness
Darkness/fog-of-war: only blocks adjacent to air (mined-out spaces) are visible; everything else is black
World is continuous: surface and underground in same world; enter shop by walking to a door and clicking it
Support 2-player gameplay (same computer and/or separate devices)
Add a movable player marker; player can mine only blocks adjacent to air (4-neighbor), and mining reveals/makes adjacent blocks visible & mineable
Add a simple hotbar-only inventory: mined blocks automatically go straight into the visible hotbar
